body_html: @ibab another example is integer Add . At some point shape-related calculations on Tensors on GPU had a bottleneck in crossing the logical device boundary, so those ops were registered with "fake" GPU implementations to avoid the overhead of crossing logical devices
body_text: @ibab another example is integer Add . At some point shape-related calculations on Tensors on GPU had a bottleneck in crossing the logical device boundary, so those ops were registered with "fake" GPU implementations to avoid the overhead of crossing logical devices
body: @ibab another example is integer [Add](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/d42facc3cc9611f0c9722c81551a7404a0bd3f6b/tensorflow/core/kernels/cwise_op_add.cc#L28) . At some point shape-related calculations on Tensors on GPU had a bottleneck in crossing the logical device boundary, so those ops were registered with "fake" GPU implementations to avoid the overhead of crossing logical devices
